Notes.Text:
This update for netatalk fixes the following issues:
  
- CVE-2022-23125: Fixed remote arbitrary code execution related to copyapplfile().
- CVE-2022-23121: Fixed remote arbitrary code execution related to parse_entries().
- CVE-2021-31439: Fixed remote arbitrary code execution related to dsi_stream_receive().
Notes.Title: Details

SUSE Linux Enterprise Workstation Extension 12 SP5

Vulnerabilities.Description: This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Synology DiskStation Manager. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerablity. The specific flaw exists within the processing of DSI structures in Netatalk. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of the length of user-supplied data prior to copying it to a heap-based buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the current process. Was ZDI-CAN-12326.
